description.narrative:
Please compare the original proposed indicators of success with the results achieved to date. Comments on any variances you feel require explanation.
Indicators of Success Identified in Proposal The indicators of success, we expect will be achieved by the end of this project phase, include
# 1 million views: individual citizens click a link to view UP materials of Oxfam or partners; : (on going) # 100.000 actions: individual citizens respond to UP activity online for example by asking a questionduring the online live streamed Q<(>&<)>A with the MAF Minister or by attending offline activity like the Policy Event on December 14 and February 21 (on going) # 1 celebrity action: the MAF Minister joins our campaign as keynote speaker at the campaign eventson December 14 and February 21 and also during supporter journey after the launching (on going)
Actual Results to Date
The case study and research on the seafood value chain in Indonesia will inform on how Oxfam further engages with the privatesector and further develops its campaign strategy. This will include the core script incorporating feedback from targeted groups designed to mobilize middle class urban consumers(especially women # millennial mothers and youth).
A strategy is underway to develop a scorecard to improve company practices and to implement international standards in the seafood value chain thereby promoting workers# welfare and rights.
A policy analysis and briefing paper assists with garnering support from various stakeholders, including government, to protect workers# rights and reduce inequalities in the fisheries sector and between women and men.
Goals Please help us understand what you achieved with this grant in relationship to the larger goals you hopedto achieve.
Expected Goals to be Achieved
1. Improved policy and practice of Indonesian government to protect worker rights and address inequality in fisheries workers, between men - women and small seafood producer (fisher folk/fish farmer) # seafood private companies. 2. Mobilized middle class urban consumers (esp. women -digital mom/millennial mom- and youth) in Indonesia to promote equality improvement in seafood VC. 3. Increased farmer/fisheries workers opportunity vocalized their right togovernment and also private companies. 4. Improved company practices to implement good standard in seafood value chain and promoted workers rights.
Goals Achieved to Date
Currently, this is project is on inception phase, and we expect can achieve the goal by the end of June 2018.

participating-org.narrative:
Novib in 1994 became a member of Oxfam International. A group of twelve independent, like-minded development organizations strivingfor a fairer world.
Oxfam's work with a total of 3,000 partner organizations in 100 countries. They maintain contacts with severalmajor international networks and civil society organizations. The collaboration began with advocacy but also extends to the projectwork and joint campaigning and relief.
One of the members of Oxfam International, Oxfam GB, an independent British organization. Oxfam GB works with volunteers, donors. Oxfam GB has an office in Jakarta.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: Improved policies Private Sector: # cases where Oxfam/partners influenced private sector actors to adopting/implementing improved policies on (i) Sustainable Food production & consumption, (ii) Land Rights (iii) Climate Change with a gender senstive lens.

cases where Oxfam/partners influenced private sector actors to adopting/implementing improved policies on (i) Sustainable Food production & consumption, (ii) Land Rights (iii) Climate Change with a gender senstive lens -DD2

Improved policies Private Sector: # cases where Oxfam/partners influenced private sector actors to adopting/implementing improved policies on (i) Sustainable Food production & consumption, (ii) Land Rights (iii) Climate Change with a gender senstive lens.
pieces of evidence (documents, studies, videos, testimonies etc.) produced by Oxfam Novib and partners in support of development/adoption of alternative policies/approaches
pieces of evidence (documents, studies, videos, testimonies etc.) produced by Oxfam Novib and partners to support monitoring of practices and implementation of policies by the private sector
